Uses of Package
ray.rage.scene

  • Packages that use ray.rage.scene 
    Package Description
    ray.rage  
    ray.rage.game  
    ray.rage.rendersystem  
    ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4  
    ray.rage.rendersystem.shader  
    ray.rage.rendersystem.shader.glsl  
    ray.rage.scene  
    ray.rage.scene.controllers  
    ray.rage.scene.generic  
    ray.rage.scene.visitors  
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage 
    Class and Description
    SceneManager
    A scene manager handles the creation, organization, and rendering of a scene, i.e., a collection of objects and potentially world geometry.
    SceneManager.Environment
    The environment is the kind of world or setting the scene-manager is expected to handle.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.game 
    Class and Description
    SceneManager
    A scene manager handles the creation, organization, and rendering of a scene, i.e., a collection of objects and potentially world geometry.
    SceneManagerFactory
    A factory to create environment-specific scene-managers.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.rendersystem 
    Class and Description
    AmbientLight
    An ambient light provides global, and evenly-distributed, illumination for an entire scene.
    Camera
    A camera is viewpoint from which the scene will be rendered.
    Light
    A light is a scene-object that can illuminate other scene-objects in a scene.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4 
    Class and Description
    AmbientLight
    An ambient light provides global, and evenly-distributed, illumination for an entire scene.
    Camera
    A camera is viewpoint from which the scene will be rendered.
    Light
    A light is a scene-object that can illuminate other scene-objects in a scene.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.rendersystem.shader 
    Class and Description

    An ambient light provides global, and evenly-distributed, illumination for an entire scene.
    Light
    A light is a scene-object that can illuminate other scene-objects in a scene.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.rendersystem.shader.glsl 
    Class and Description
    AmbientLight
    An ambient light provides global, and evenly-distributed, illumination for an entire scene.
    Light
    A light is a scene-object that can illuminate other scene-objects in a scene.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.scene 
    Class and Description
    AmbientLight
    An ambient light provides global, and evenly-distributed, illumination for an entire scene.
    Camera
    A camera is viewpoint from which the scene will be rendered.
    Camera.Frustum
    A frustum represents a pyramid, capped at the near and far end, which is used to represent either a visible area or a projection area.
    Camera.Frustum.Projection
    Specifies the projection the camera should use.
    Camera.Listener
    Listener interface to notify clients of camera events.
    Entity
    An entity defines a discrete scene-object based on a mesh.
    Light
    A light is a scene-object that can illuminate other scene-objects in a scene.
    Light.Type 
    ManualObject
    A manual object defines a discrete scene-object whose geometric data must be directly specified by the client.
    ManualObjectSection
    A manual object section is a renderable part of a manual-object.
    Node
    A node is a general-purpose object used to represent an articulated graph.
    Node.Controller
    A controller handles nodes make it easier to apply behaviors by concrete implementations.
    Node.Listener
    A listener for Node events.
    SceneManager
    A scene manager handles the creation, organization, and rendering of a scene, i.e., a collection of objects and potentially world geometry.
    SceneManager.Environment
    The environment is the kind of world or setting the scene-manager is expected to handle.
    SceneManager.Listener
    A listener for scene-manager events.
    SceneNode
    A scene node is a node used as the basis for a tree-based scene graph data structure, allowing scene-objects to be attached to the scene nodes.
    SceneObject
    A scene object is an object that can be placed in a scene by getting attached to a scene-node.
    SceneObject.Listener
    Listener for scene-object-related events.
    SkeletalEntity
    A Skeletal Entity extends the notion of an Entity to add support for Skeletal animations using a skeleton, and a mesh.
    SkeletalEntity.EndType 
    SkyBox
    A sky box is a textured cube that simulates the presence of a sky, ground, and horizon in a scene.
    SkyBox.Face
    The faces of a sky-box are the "sides" onto which textures get mapped.
    SubEntity
    A sub entity is a renderable part of an entity, much like the independent pieces of a jigsaw puzzle forms a whole picture.
    SubEntity.Visitor
    Visitor interface for sub-entities.
    Tessellation
    A tessellation is a textured plane that is primarily used to simulate terrain in a scene.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.scene.controllers 
    Class and Description
    Node
    A node is a general-purpose object used to represent an articulated graph.
    Node.Controller
    A controller handles nodes make it easier to apply behaviors by concrete implementations.

    A listener for scene-manager events.
    SceneManagerFactory

    SceneObject.Listener
    Listener for scene-object-related events.
    SkeletalEntity

    SkeletalEntity.EndType 
    SkyBox

    SkyBox.Face
    The faces of a sky-box are the "sides" onto which textures get mapped.
    SubEntity
    A sub entity is a renderable part of an entity, much like the independent pieces of a jigsaw puzzle forms a whole picture.
    SubEntity.Visitor
    Visitor interface for sub-entities.
    Tessellation
    A tessellation is a textured plane that is primarily used to simulate terrain in a scene.
    TessellationBody
    A tessellation body is the renderable part of a tessellation.
  • Classes in ray.rage.scene used by ray.rage.scene.visitors 
    Class and Description
